Adult male.description: Pyrrhuloxias have a yellow bill whereas Northern Cardinals have a red bill. Adult males are also grayer overall than female Northern Cardinals.

Adult female.description: Pyrrhuloxias have a yellow bill whereas Northern Cardinals have a red bill. Adult females are grayer overall than female Northern Cardinals, which are more brown.

Female.description: Female Phainopeplas lack any redness to their plumage and have much more slender bills than female Northern Cardinals.

Breeding male.description: Breeding male Scarlet Tanagers are brilliant red like adult male Northern Cardinals, but they have black wings and a black tail.

Adult male.description: Adult male Summer Tanagers lack the male Northern Cardinal's crest and black face patch. They also have a longer, straighter bill compared to the thick conical bill of the cardinal.

Adult.description: California Towhees and other towhee species do not have reddish highlights in the wings, tail, and crest like female Northern Cardinals.
